page.title: 07RELIGION
page.content: There is a variety of Christian churches to be found in and around Southborough. Two of the largest are St.Thomas's and the united parish of St.Peter with Christ Church and St.Matthew, with three vicars. There is one Methodist church, the only one remaining from a selection that once served the area. Several redundant chapels can be found in amongst the Victorian and Edwardian housing. A modern Roman Catholic church, St.Dunstan's, serves the surrounding area. One small Jehovah's Witness Hall is based in an old shop on London Road. Over the last 10 years congregations have been falling. Some churches have active youth groups but most seem to have support from the older age group. There are however no redundant churches in the area.
